result.execSummary:
The defendant Moses J Butler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Burglarious Tools, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.12.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 3 years probation; conditions of probation fine/costs totaling $601.00; obtain GED/HSED; DNA sample and surcharge.  Upon successful completion of probation automatic expungement.

miscConds.notes: $250.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Def. to get an HSED or GED.
Upon notice from Probation of the defendants successful completion of  the terms of this sentence, and having no further crimes,  the court will automatically expunge this record.

$351.00  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Moses J Butler

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Moses J Butler in court with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State motions to amend to Possesion of Burglarious Tools 943.12 Felony 1 Court grants motion to amend.  Advised of rights; joint recommendation; parties stipulate to facts; PSI waived; victim notification completed; Defendant pleads NC to the Amended Ct. 1; court finds guilty and convicts on Amended Ct. 1;  Sentence Withheld; 3 years probation; conditions of probation; DNA sample & surcharge; fine/costs totaling $601.00; obtain GED/HSED;  Upon successful completion automatic expungment.  Appeal rights; plea questionnaire filed; report to probation and parole today.

Defendant Moses J Butler in court with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer by phone(ill).  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DEF stands mute, DEF found NG by court,   Acknowledges receipt of information, Bond continues.   Scheduling conference scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Moses J Butler in court with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DEF waives right to preliminary hearing  Arraignment scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Moses J Butler in court with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Off record.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Letter from Attorney Moldenhauer requesting to reschedule hearing from 12/16/14 until sometime after 12/28/14.
Scheduling conference on January 13, 2015 at 10:00 am.

APPEARANCES:  Defendant Moses J Butler in court with Attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer via phone.  Bruce R. Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant advised of rights/penalties and acknowledges receipt of complaint.  DE waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  

Scheduling conference scheduled for December 16, 2014 at 10:00 am.

DEF Moses Butler in court with Atty Martin Jarvis for initial appearance.  Bruce Poquette appears for the State.  State is still awaiting reports.  Bond continues.  Initial appearance scheduled for 10-28-14 @ 8:30 am.

DEF Moses Butler in court, in custody by video.  Bruce Poquette appears for the State.  Court finds probable cause.  Court orders $5000 signature bond.  Initial appearance set for September 23, 2014 @ 8:30 am.
